div.head: To the Worthy deseruer of that Antient and honorable Title, Sir THOMAS HEVVET Knight.
div.p:
YOu shall behold drawne (on this paper) certaine Plat-formes of ground, vppon which two mightie, and (almost) inuincible Armies are this present Summer to ioyne Battaile: Here you may knowe what Trenches they cast vp, what fortifications they raise, what Rampires, what Parapets, what Counterscapes, &c. Let it not appeare strange, that from the Regiment of knights Military, I
make choise of you, to be a Chiefe in •… e best of these armies (you beeing no professed Warriour.) But I my selfe serue on the one side, and the World markes you out to be an able Commaunder in the other. Before the Allarum be strucke vp, behold I offer my selfe (and all the forces which I leade) into your hands. With the Pen, (a most daungerous peece of Artillery) doe I vse to come into the field: That shall be discharged to do you all the Honour it may, and I be ready, in any seruice fitting such a souldier, to Fight.

closer.signed: Yours vnder the Cullors of your Loue, Thomas Dekker.
